alert.note: Alert for Cowley; Elk (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 7:33PM CDT until May 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR ELK...COWLEY AND NORTHERN CHAUTAUQUA COUNTIES... At 733 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Geuda Springs, or near Arkansas City, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Arkansas City, Winfield, Udall, Howard, Burden, Moline, Longton, Dexter, Grenola, Atlanta, Geuda Springs, Elk Falls, Rock, Cambridge, Hale, Maple City, Winfield City Lake and Strother Field Airport. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
